verses.text: And it came to pass, when he had made an end of speaking unto Saul , that the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David , and Jonathan loved him as his own soul.
And Saul took him that day , and would let him go no more home to his father’s house.
Then Jonathan and David made a covenant , because he loved him as his own soul.
And Jonathan stripped himself of the robe that \add was\add* upon him, and gave it to David , and his garments , even to his sword , and to his bow , and to his girdle. \p

¶ And David went out whithersoever Saul sent him, \add and\add* behaved himself wisely : and Saul set him over the men of war , and he was accepted in the sight of all the people , and also in the sight of Saul’s servants.\f + \fr 18.5 \ft behaved…: or, prospered\f* \p

And it came to pass as they came , when David was returned from the slaughter of the Philistine , that the women came out of all cities of Israel , singing and dancing , to meet king Saul , with tabrets , with joy , and with instruments of musick.\f + \fr 18.6 \ft Philistine: or, Philistines\f*\f + \fr 18.6 \ft instruments…: Heb. three stringed instruments\f*
And the women answered \add one another\add* as they played , and said , Saul hath slain his thousands , and David his ten thousands.

And Saul was very wroth , and the saying displeased him; and he said , They have ascribed unto David ten thousands , and to me they have ascribed \add but\add* thousands : and \add what\add* can he have more but the kingdom ?\f + \fr 18.8 \ft displeased him: Heb. was evil in his eyes\f*
And Saul eyed David from that day and forward. \p

¶ And it came to pass on the morrow , that the evil spirit from God came upon Saul , and he prophesied in the midst of the house : and David played with his hand , as at other times : and \add there was\add* a javelin in Saul’s hand.
And Saul cast the javelin ; for he said , I will smite David even to the wall \add with it\add*. And David avoided out of his presence twice. \p
¶ And Saul was afraid of David , because the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was with him, and was departed from Saul.
Therefore Saul removed him from him, and made him his captain over a thousand ; and he went out and came in before the people.
And David behaved himself wisely in all his ways ; and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add was\add* with him.\f + \fr 18.14 \ft behaved…: or, prospered\f*
Wherefore when Saul saw that he behaved himself very wisely , he was afraid of him.
But all Israel and Judah loved David , because he went out and came in before them. \p

¶ And Saul said to David , Behold my elder daughter Merab , her will I give thee to wife : only be thou valiant for me, and fight the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* battles. For Saul said , Let not mine hand be upon him, but let the hand of the Philistines be upon him.\f + \fr 18.17 \ft valiant: Heb. a son of valour\f*
And David said unto Saul , Who \add am\add* I? and what \add is\add* my life , \add or\add* my father’s family in Israel , that I should be son in law to the king ?
But it came to pass at the time when Merab Saul’s daughter should have been given to David , that she was given unto Adriel the Meholathite to wife.
And Michal Saul’s daughter loved David : and they told Saul , and the thing pleased him.\f + \fr 18.20 \ft pleased him: Heb. was right in his eyes\f*

And Saul said , I will give him her, that she may be a snare to him, and that the hand of the Philistines may be against him. Wherefore Saul said to David , Thou shalt this day be my son in law in \add the one of\add* the twain. \p

¶ And Saul commanded his servants , \add saying\add*, Commune with David secretly , and say , Behold, the king hath delight in thee, and all his servants love thee: now therefore be the king’s son in law.

And Saul’s servants spake those words in the ears of David. And David said , Seemeth it to you \add a\add* light \add thing\add* to be a king’s son in law , seeing that I \add am\add* a poor man , and lightly esteemed ?
And the servants of Saul told him, saying , On this manner spake David.\f + \fr 18.24 \ft On…: Heb. According to these words\f*

And Saul said , Thus shall ye say to David , The king desireth not any dowry , but an hundred foreskins of the Philistines , to be avenged of the king’s enemies. But Saul thought to make David fall by the hand of the Philistines.
And when his servants told David these words , it pleased David well to be the king’s son in law : and the days were not expired.\f + \fr 18.26 \ft expired: Heb. fulfilled\f*

Wherefore David arose and went , he and his men , and slew of the Philistines two hundred men ; and David brought their foreskins , and they gave them in full tale to the king , that he might be the king’s son in law. And Saul gave him Michal his daughter to wife. \p
¶ And Saul saw and knew that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add was\add* with David , and \add that\add* Michal Saul’s daughter loved him.
And Saul was yet the more afraid of David ; and Saul became David’s enemy continually.

Then the princes of the Philistines went forth : and it came to pass, after they went forth , \add that\add* David behaved himself more wisely than all the servants of Saul ; so that his name was much set by.\f + \fr 18.30 \ft set by: Heb. precious\f*
